job_description:
Interested in a job in IT and contributing to a better world? Discover your best self with the Young Engineering Professional Program.
You and your future
During the Young Engineering Professional Program (also known as YEPP) at Rabobank you work on your career one day a week by following a technical track, or you work on your personal development. You develop talents you didn’t know you had and we are given the space to discover for yourself what you are good at and what you like. And then? Everything you learn in the training courses can immediately be put into practice, because the other 4 days you work in your starter position as a Junior Azure Platform Engineer. Under the guidance of experienced colleagues, you will become a specialist in your field in no time. In addition, in the program you will work together with the team on 2 business challenges on themes such as sustainable agriculture or the cooperative energy transition.
Developing, improving, managing, documenting and maintaining our advanced analytics platform Azure. That’s what you do together with colleagues in an agile team. You improve our operational processes through further automation and strengthen the team by proactively proposing system and process improvements. You monitor the performance of systems and offer (ad hoc) solutions to keep the platform running. As platform Engineer you use your knowledge of Linux, Python and Azure to provide the best self-service platform for our users (analysts and data scientists) to solve complex problems and deliver analysis products.
Examples
Provide a Self-Service Portal & Management Portal through internal market place application, for which we provide the API calls to run and operate our platform.
Continue development of the Azure environment for data analyses of multiple teams.
Practical
Length: Young Engineering Professional Program: 18 months.
After which you will continue to work with us as Azure Platform Engineer.
Hours per week: 40.
Your development
To become the specialist in your professional field, in the Young Engineering Professional Program 1 day a week you mainly attend training courses that that support your talent development. The courses are often given by experienced colleagues or trainers with a track record. You build your network, gain valuable experience and develop skills which will be of use to you later in your career.
Learning from each other
Development is our top priority. Because the best way to learn is by doing, through mistakes and successes. At Rabobank we offer you the right balance between freedom and supervision. To develop talents you never thought you possessed. To specialize in a professional field or explore the things you're good at and enjoy doing. During the Young Engineering Professional Program you can count on us for excellent supervision. You'll work with experienced colleagues and have lots of contact with young professionals.
Talking of Rabobank: We are a Dutch bank that operates in 38 countries for over 9,500,000 customers. Together with these customers, our members and partners we stand side by side to create a world in which everyone has access to enough healthy food. In the Netherlands we work to create a country in which people are happy with how they live, work and do business.
You and your talent
A bachelor or master degree, or an equivalent working / thinking level.
Affinity with software development, and already some experience with the Azure Cloud technology.
Excellent proficiency in English.
Feedback makes you stronger.
Learns from mistakes.
Adaptive to changing situations.
Focus on the solution.
This is what we offer you
Most of all, we offer you an 18 month long rich learning experience, while you advance your career towards an expert in your field.
A gross monthly salary starting at € 3.300 in function scale 7.
A combination of working from home and at the office.
This is a selection of the terms of employment for a Junior Azure Platform Engineer based on a 40-hour working week.

You and the job application process
We believe in the power of difference. Bringing together people's differences is what makes us an even better bank. What can you bring to Rabobank? We can't wait to hear from you.
So get in touch straightaway:
An assessment is part of the selection process.
Interviews will be held via MS Teams or at our office in Utrecht.
A security check is part of the process.
We respect your privacy.

Interested in a job in IT and working on your technical development? Discover your best self with the Young Engineering Professional Program. Create impact by developing innovative banking applications on the market, while developing yourself together with other Professionals towards an expert coder in the Young Engineering Professional Program IT also known as YEPP.
You and your future
During this Young Engineering Professional Program at Rabobank, you work on your career as a Junior Data Engineer working in our department you have the opportunity to gain experience in several areas of programming, systems development and development and maintenance of a cloud data warehouse. This gives you the opportunity to get acquainted with several areas of data engineering as large datasets, performance tuning in a cloud environment and various other fields of systems development.
Examples
Develop, maintain and optimize reliable and robust data pipelines.
We work with Azure and Devops.
Bringing models into production and manage and make the best off them!
Optimize and automate tasks.
Practical
Length: Young Engineering Professional Program: 18 months
After which you will continue to work with us as Junior Data Engineer
Hours per week: 40
Your development
To become the specialist in your professional field, in the first 18 months you mainly attend training courses that relate directly to your specialism and that support your talent development. The courses are often given by experienced colleagues or trainers with a track record.

You build your network, gain valuable experience and develop skills which will be of use to you later in your career. We also challenge you and other professionals and trainees to work on various cases and challenges one day a week.
Learning from each other
Development is our top priority. Because the best way to learn is by doing, through mistakes and successes. At Rabobank we offer you the right balance between freedom and supervision. To develop talents, you never thought you possessed. To specialize in a professional field or explore the things you're good at and enjoy doing. During your: Young Engineering Professional Program IT you can count on us for excellent supervision. You'll work with experienced colleagues and have lots of contact with professionals.
"As a bank we generate large data sets. As a Data Engineer you can add a lot of value by delivering the right data model for the specific client needs, and make them available for different data science projects. You’ll also play an important role into once they go into production, a versatile and essential role. “
Medior Data Engineer
Talking of Rabobank: We are a Dutch bank that operates in 38 countries for over 9,5000,000 customers. Together with these customers, our members and partners we stand side by side to create a world in which everyone has access to enough healthy food. In the Netherlands we work to create a country in which people are happy with how they live, work and do business.
You and your talent
A bachelor or master's degree, or an equivalent working / thinking level
Dutch speaking is required
Analytical thinking
Good communication skills verbal as well as in writing
feedback makes you stronger
Focus on the solution
Customer focus
Adaptive to changing situations
Affinity with Data & Analytics, Azure and Devops
This is what we offer you
Most of all, we offer you a rich learning experience, while you advance your career towards an expert in your field
Hybrid Home/Office work environment
A gross monthly salary starting at € 3.300 in function scale 7
A personal development budget of € 1,400-
This is a selection of the terms of employment for a Junior Data Engineer YEPP based on a 40-hour working week.
You and the job application process
We believe in the power of difference. Bringing together people's differences is what makes us an even better bank. What can you bring to Rabobank? We can't wait to hear from you!
So, get in touch straightaway:
The interview experience will be virtual and consists of two steps.
An assessment is part of the selection process.
A security check is part of the process.
We respect your privacy.

Making your impact with developing innovative banking applications on the market, while developing yourself together with other Young Professionals towards an expert coder in the Young Professional Program IT Engineering also known as YEPP.
You and your job
Working as a Low Code developer within a squad where business and IT collaborate closely to make a difference in the way Rabobank engages with its customers and to become the driving force behind excellent customer experiences. Together with your squad members you will be responsible to create seamless journeys with Pega technology in the cloud for both our customers and our employees. You will get the opportunity to work with the newest developments in the market in your role as Junior Low Code developer and to contribute to developing applications in Pega in the Young Professional Program IT Engineering. At the same time, you work with other Young Professionals on several business challenges, that cover broader topics within the bank.
Practical Examples
We make it possible to onboard new customers fully digital, including comprehensive mobile identification
The squads launched a big improvement initiative to increase the collaboration between the squads
Facts & Figures
40 hours per week
43,822 Rabobank colleagues around the world
Top 3 responsibilities
Developing Pega solutions that support the customer journeys. You build it, you run it!
Continuously improving from a business perspective and end user perspective (both customers and employees)
Continuously improving from an IT delivery perspective(CI/CD, Quality Assurance, Team performance)
Are you in it for the bugs? Then you might just be the CSS to our HTML. Can you put the code behind your ideas? Your craftmanship has an impact and can make a difference for both the bank and society.
Want to see some of these innovations in (technical) detail? Check Rabobank.jobs/techblog
Together we achieve more than alone
We believe in the power of difference. Bringing together people's differences is what makes us an even better bank. So, we are very curious about what you can bring to our team at Digital Customer Processes Tech (DCP Tech).
“Being part of a culture where autonomous teams are able to use the latest technologies, accelerate and support each other based on trust and transparency makes me smile everyday”
IT Lead DCP Tech
In DCP Tech we create seamless cross channel journeys for complex customer processes with a future proof technology in a high performing engineering culture. Working together is the way we work; as 1 passionate team at Rabobank. Talking of Rabobank: We are a Dutch bank that operates in 38 countries for over 9,5000,000 customers. Together with these customers, our members and partners we stand side by side to create a world in which everyone has access to enough healthy food. In the Netherlands we work to create a country in which people are happy with how they live, work and do business.
You and your talent
A bachelor or master degree, or an equivalent working / thinking level
Work experience within IT or IT related
Affinity with software development, and already some experience with the programming language Pega
Feedback makes you stronger
Focus on the solution
Adaptive to changing situations
This is what we offer you
Most of all, we offer you a rich learning experience, while you advance your career towards an expert in your field
A combination of working from home and at the office #LI-Hybrid
A gross monthly salary starting at € 3.400 in function scale 7
Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance
An extra budget of 10% of your gross monthly salary to be used at your discretion. Buy extra holiday hours, add more to your pension savings, or ask for part of the extra budget to be paid out.
A personal development budget of € 1,400,-
This is a selection of the terms of employment for a Junior Low Code developer based on a 40-hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment.
You and the job application processThe interview experience will be virtual, and consists of two steps.A technical assessment and/or a personality assessment is part of the selection process.You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/nl/veelgestelde-vragen.A security check is part of the process.We respect your privacy
Do you want to know more about YEPP? You can find more information on Young Engineering's Professional Programma - Werken bij Rabobank Check also the video's for the experience of previous YPP'ers!

Your focus is to drive and implement learning interventions to build knowledge and skills on required and desired compliance and risk management topics. And contribute to the improvement of compliance risk management and the compliance function by working with us to support our colleagues to act with integrity.
You and your job
Supporting and challenging Rabobank to safeguard integrity by creating awareness that behavioral risk is considered as part of day to day activities and that knowledge of those risks is crucial to deal with dilemmas and risks in daily practice. Addressing the opportunities of behavioral and cultural factors that impact sound compliance risk management and building a strong compliance function as well as translating strategic outlines into change strategies, content and design of new interventions are part of your role.
Practical Examples
Reinforce risk & integrity awareness by contributing your expertise to RiskWise products and offerings, such as learning Journeys
Translate the outcomes of root causes analysis into tools and content for training and professional development
Support change leadership by providing advice, interventions and tools on behavioral risk management
Facts & Figures
36 hours per week
 6 team members with the same goal but a different expertise than yours
43,822 Rabobank colleagues around the world
Top 3 responsibilities
Contribute to the understanding of the essentials of compliant working by driving, implementing and continuously improving RiskWise mandatory learnings and non-mandatory offering.
Working together with internal business partners throughout the three lines of responsibility to identify topics and content to design interventions to boost required and desired behavioral change to ensure a healthy risk attitude and compliance to the Code of Conduct
Bring innovative ideas and improvement suggestions to ensure sustainable impact of learning interventions and operational effectiveness in order to support the organization to learn & adjust as good as possible.
Next to this you will be taking an active approach to stimulate that developments, insights, employee feedback and stakeholder interactions are utilized to encourage adequate behavioral risk management. Providing expertise, content and good practices to encourage a learning organization. Monitoring of external requirements and trends, industry guidance and good practices on risk culture and learning practices are also important in your position.
Together we achieve more than alone
We believe in the power of difference. Bringing together people's differences is what makes us an even better bank. So we are very curious about what you can bring to our team at Compliance Behavioral Risk & Integrity
‘We are a team with a lot of different characters but all of us have a can do attitude. I appreciate the openness, respect for each individual quality and the common drive of the colleagues in this team to address and support the behavior of the organization. We trust and rely on each other and at the same time we are challenging towards ourselves and others, committed to deliver the highest possible standard for our work in order to support our colleagues the best way we can. I think that is why we accomplish a lot with a small team whilst enjoying what we do’
Michelle Jentjens, Compliance Officer Behavioral Risk & Integrity
The seven people in Compliance Behavioral Risk & Integrity contribute to sustainable behavioral change to establish a risk aware workforce acting with integrity. Working together is the way we work; as 1 problem-solving team at Rabobank. Talking of Rabobank: We are a Dutch bank that operates in 38 countries for over 9,5000,000 customers. Together with these customers, our members and partners we stand side by side to create a world in which everyone has access to enough healthy food. In the Netherlands we work to create a country in which people are happy with how they live, work and do business.
You and your talent
Ba or Ma degree with at least 5 years working experience in (behavioral) risk management or behavioral science, preferably in the field of change management, people and business management or innovation.
Certification or equivalent degree in the field of content creation, (online) marketing, communication or learning & development is preferred;
Experience within complex environments in different positions, including experience with the 2nd line responsibility is a plus
Strong (project) leadership, agile and execution capabilities;
Excellent stakeholder management and relationship building skills.
Excellent knowledge of the Dutch and English language (both written and verbally).
This is what we offer you
up to € € 5655,50 gross per month (scale 9)
a 13th month and holiday allowance of 8,3%
Employee Benefit Budget of 11%, which you can spend for example to buy extra holiday days
Working Hybride
Working from home allowance
This is a selection of the terms of employment for a Compliance Officer Behavioral Risk & Integrity
based on a 36-hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment.

You and the job application process
Reply to the vacancy for Compliance Officer Behavioral Risk & Integrity at Rabobank before April 2nd.
Any questions about the job content? Contact: Danielle Dielissen, Team Lead at Compliance Behavioral Risk & Integrity via Danielle.Dielissen@rabobank.nl] or +31 610949903.
Responses will be handled in accordance with vacancy management.
Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Katja Volmerink, Senior Recruiter Compliance via katja.volmerink@rabobank.nl.
We will hold the interviews initially through a video call and physical meeting further in the process.
You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/en/faq.
A security check and a HFM assessment is part of the process.
We respect your privacy.

As Analytics Delivery Manager you are responsible for the delivery of data science solutions and maintaining these solutions in production. You will lead a multi-disciplinary team of Data Engineers, ML Engineers and Data Scientists.
You and your job
Your experience in data science and MLops will be your guide as you lead a team of data scientists and engineers in the day-to-day delivery of a data science solution. Your knowledge of data science and your affinity with product management and stakeholder management allows you to make sure the team works efficiently and effectively towards a common end goal. In the role of the product owner, you prioritize, manage risks, dependencies and timelines.
Practical Examples
Develop a product vision and roadmap
Manage a complex stakeholder field and ensure your solution is what they need
Prioritize your backlog, have stand-ups and sprint planning with your squad
Facts & Figures
You work with 90 other colleagues with 15+ nationalities
Monthly learning sessions to share ideas and exchange knowledge
The department has end-to-end responsibility of 10+ ML solutions
Top 3 responsibility`s
Be curious, build relationships and translate business needs to analytics solutions
Prioritize your backlog, manage risks, dependencies and timelines
Set the stage for others to learn, have fun and excel
Together we achieve more than alone
Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do. The team brings diverse and talented people together to perform the best they can.
“I enjoy the fast pace dynamics within the Data Science Area. The Analytic Delivery Manager role is very diverse. You go from strategic sessions with stakeholders where you try to find a fitting analytics solution for a certain business challenge, to the nitty gritty details of building that product during a refinement with your team.”
Milou Graas, Expert Lead
You will be part of a very dynamic and international team including highly motivated team members.
Working together is the way we work; as 1 results-driven, data-minded and analytical team at Rabobank. Talking of Rabobank: We are a Dutch bank that operates in 38 countries for over 9,5000,000 customers. Together with these customers, our members and partners we stand side by side to create a world in which everyone has access to enough healthy food. In the Netherlands we work to create a country in which people are happy with how they live, work and do business.
You and your talent
Master or PhD degree
>3 years of relevant working experience in advanced analytics
Experience with product delivery, scrum and stakeholder management
Experience in guiding and motivating multidisciplinary teams
Entrepreneurial mindset
This is what we offer you
€4718,88 up to € 6741,24 gross per month based on 36 hour work week (scale 10)
Extra budget of 11% of your gross salary to be used at your discretion. Buy extra holiday hours, add more to your pension savings or ask for part of the extra budget to be paid out.
Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance
This is a selection of the terms of employment for an Analytics Delivery Manager based on a 36-hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment.
You and the job application process
Interested? Reply to the vacancy.
Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Sandy van Kints, Senior Recruiter via sandy.van.kints@rabobank.nl
We will hold the interviews through a video call.
You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on Frequently asked questions - Careers at Rabobank
A security check is part of the process.
We respect your privacy.

job_titles: Azure Software Engineer (Global Data Platform- Team Maximus)
job_description:
As an Azure Software Engineer you will work in a scrum team focusing on the Global Data Platform (GDP). All data from the Rabobank will eventually be stored in the Azure Cloud. The Global Data Platform enables a governed data market place and offers products & services for Data Producer and Data Consumer teams. You will work in the Data Accelerator Framework team that generates data pipeline artifacts to kickstart the development of the users of our platform. Initial offerings include a dummy test data generator and templates for Azure Data Factory and Airflow. Your responsibilities will include the development of web applications with Python on our Azure Cloud Platform. Requirements and functional analysis is part of the work. The solutions created need to be usable, resilient, scalable and secure, and you think customer first. We participate in multi-disciplinary teams. This requires team work and clear communication to get the work done.
Who we are:
The Global Data Platform is one of the areas within Rabobank’s Tribe Data & Analytics (D&A). Together with other areas like e.g. Data Management Office Business Intelligence & Data Science we contribute to the purpose of the Tribe D&A to “Create value out of Data, at scale”. Our area comprises 15 DevOps teams that offer products & services for building and operating data pipelines and data governance to provide and consume reliable data.
Experience (Requirements)
At least 3 years of experience in a similar functionAt least 1 year of experience in a data-driven environmentGood command of English (business level)Proven experience in:
o Software engineering
o CI/CD and Infrastructure as Code
o Architectural design and convincing stakeholders
o Able to mentor other team members

Must Have:
Technical skills:
o Proficient with Python as a programming language
o Experience in designing web applications
o FastAPI, REST and PyTest
o Experience with infrastructure-as-code (Azure Bicep or similar)
o Experience with pipelines-as-code (Azure DevOps)
Soft skills:
o Eye for detail
o Design skills and able to convince others of design decisions
o You can handle tasks individually but value peer reviews and input of fellow developers
o You have an agile mindset and keep an eye out for any improvements in team processes
Nice to have:
Experience in the financial sector and data scienceExperience in business analysis or interested in executing BA tasksExperience in Apache AirflowExperience with Azure services:Azure Data FactoryAzure Storage AccountsAzure Log AnalyticsAzure Container RegistryAzure DatabricksExperience working with Pandas and Parquet
Salary & Benefits
Do you want to become the ideal version of yourself within an engineering culture? We would love to help you achieve this by focusing firmly on your growth, development, and investing in an environment where you keep learning every day. We give you the space to innovate and initiate. In this way, we offer you numerous opportunities to grow and help you exceed your expectations, to do the right thing exceptionally well, and to therefore grow as a professional. In addition, with us (on the basis of a 40 hour working week), you can also expect:
A gross monthly salary is scaled in function group 8; Between € 3.800 and €5.400 based on a 40hrs working week.
A guarantee (13) thirteenth month and holiday pay (8%);
An Employee Benefit Budget (10% of your monthly salary); you decide how to spend this budget. This may include purchasing extra leave days, making extra pension contributions or even receiving extra cash on a monthly basis;
A personal budget that you can spend on activities related to your personal development and career.
€40 Net internet allowance
Working from home allowance
100 % reimbursement of commuting costs if you travel by public transport! Do you still prefer to travel by car or motorbike? Then choose a commuting allowance;
A pension scheme, to which your contribution is only 5,5%.
What we offer as Team
State of the art solutions for you to work on.Close contact with Microsoft experts about roadmap, features, services and supportWe design, develop, manage and operate our own platform.Our teams are dedicated towards providing excellent technical performance. Help us achieve even higher availability and performance for hundreds of consuming developer teams.We provide an environment where you can experiment, prototype, develop and automate as much as you like – as long as it delivers business value.High degree of independence as a team.Many valuable resources for you to develop your skills. Think: a dedicated Microsoft learning platform and free exam vouchers.
Interested?
Are you the person we're looking for? Are you ready to join Rabobank and make a difference to yourself, our customers and the society? We look forward receiving your application for this vacancy in Utrecht. (Hybrid) #LI-Onsite, #LI-Hybrid, #LI-Remote
Good to know:
Apply via the button “Apply now”. Responses will be handled in accordance with our vacancy management policy. Cv’s sent directly to my e-mail or via LinkedIn messages will be delete it according to GDPR guidelines.
Senior Recruiter Jonathan Moreno Gonzalez: Jonathan.Moreno.Gonzalez@rabobank.nl
The application process includes screening. Based on the screening procedures in place at Rabobank, we assess whether new staff are reliable enough to work at Rabobank
Everyone is different, and it is exactly those differences that help us become an even better bank. That's why we want to know who you really are!

As a global leader Consultancy, Assurance, Tax and Transactions services, we’re using the finance products, expertise and systems we’ve developed to build a better working world. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better.
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support,
inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your
unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional
experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.
The opportunity
EY is the only professional services firm with a separate business unit (“CFO consulting”) that is dedicated to the CFO agenda. The CFO agenda includes all responsibilities and transformational topics that the CFO takes care of. Our CFO consulting team consists of different competencies to enable exceptional CFO services addressing the CFO agenda items. By leveraging Financial and Regulatory Technology (FinTech / RegTech), the Client’s data and external data to its full potential, our team has been at the forefront of events that have reshaped and refined the financial services industry.
We are looking for a driven and ambitious Consultant to join this exciting and fast growing
CFO consulting group. If you are someone who enjoys working with Data & Analytics and likes using cutting
edge technology to tackle complex analytical questions, then this is the opportunity for you!
What can you expect – enriching experiences that will last a lifetime
The use of technology to make faster, targeted, more risk based decisions with a focus on the consumer, is the future of prudential supervision and policy-making. The growth of FinTechs and RegTech can be attributed to increased security concerns, acceleration of financial services’ digitization, and new frontier technologies. The growing need for governance and accountability during the pandemic, new market entrants, and the increasing security concerns from disruptive technologies, including distributed ledger and artificial intelligence, have increased the rise of RegTech. Startups employing Technology and Data & Analytics solutions (e.g. AI and machine learning) are reshaping FinTech and the overall financial sector.
As a FinTech consultant you navigate your clients through the increasingly complex and rapidly changing (regulatory) environment, which can impact business decision-making, and transform these changes into opportunities. You are contributing to the key topics on the CFO agenda by:
Doing project based work in teams to advise clients on topics such as; (advanced) data
analytics, data management, improving data driven decision making processes and designing and implementing machine learning/AI algorithms
Doing project-based work in a team to advice clients on major expertise topics as Finance Transformation, Data Strategy, Regulatory change programs, Data driven (regulatory) reporting, Regulatory Compliance, Basel IV and many others, in that way building long-lasting relationships with our clients in the financial sector
Designing (interactive) dashboards and other analytics solutions to provide key new insights and presenting your work in presentations or client reports
Combining various skills, such as programming, data analysis, visualization, executive presentation, storytelling, writing skills, project management and working with various cultures and backgrounds
Working across multiple projects, realizing a steep learning curve on multiple topics
Working in teams and at the same time working independently; at our offices, remote, as well as at the clients offices
What you can contribute – skills for shaping the future
As a Consultant you have 0-3 years of prior working experience or you (recently) graduated from University
Master degree in Business Informatics, Economics, Data Science, Business Analytics, Finance or another related field
You have a keen interest in AI, (Intelligent) Automation, RPA and programming (e.g. in SQL, Python and R)
Experience with visualization technology (e.g. PowerBI, Tableau) are considered beneficial
You have an international mind-set and are very open to work with different cultures
You have a strong personality and you know how to get things done
You are fluent in English, both in verbal and in writing. Dutch is considered beneficial given the landscape of Dutch clients
What we are offering – an inspiring work environment
We offer a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. Our comprehensive Total Rewards package includes support for flexible working and career development. At EY, your competencies and your areas of interest will determine your future, plus:
We offer you intensive training (hard & soft skills) and education besides your work, coaching by a personal counselor and mentor, and support with education - temporal and financial;
We encourage a healthy life-work balance. It is possible to work time and place independent: our policy on work from home, holidays and leave days is flexible.
Discover the possibilities for rapid professional and personal development; experience an optimal career start that consists of exciting tasks in challenging projects, early assumption of responsibility, learning from experienced colleagues, and a lifelong network.
Become part of our high-performing teams!
An (online) assessment and a pre employment screening are part of the application procedure.
Due to laws and regulations, and because EY (and in some cases its clients) has high demands on the reliability and integrity of its employees, every new employee will be screened. Depending on your rank the pre employment screening could contain the following: Certificate of Conduct (in Dutch: VOG) or - if requesting a Dutch VOG is not possible - Criminal Background Check of the country you are currently living or have lived during the last five years, integrity questionnaire, verification of ID, diploma’s and/or work experience and consultation of the Dutch insolvency registry.

job_titles: IMI CIB - Assistant RM Internship - Amsterdam
job_description:
Intesa Sanpaolo is the banking group leader in Italy. Assisting more than 14,6 milion of retail customers through a network of 5360 branches, it significantly supports the development of Companies and gives an important sustain to the country's growth. The Group has a selected retail banking presence in Central and Eastern Europe, the Middle East and North Africa, with approximately 1,000 branches and 7.2 million customers in 12 countries. Intesa Sanpaolo is also present in 25 countries in support of its corporate customers’ cross-border business. It is looking for new qualified profiles who want to face demanding and challenging career path with the following requirements:

Introduction
We are looking for people who have just graduated and are interested in Business, Economics or Engineer
Teamworking, problem solving and analytical skills are what we are looking for in our new colleagues.
You will be in a team, working on Corporate relationship
Assist the relevant RM / GRM in developing and maintaining new and existing relationships;Assist on new business development;Support RM / GRM in all administrative activities related to the assigned Customer Portfolio and prospective customers;Assist RM / GRM in the preparation of credit proposals;
Assist the RM / GRM in reviewing documentation related to transactions;;Assists the RM / GRM in monitoring the quality of each credit and promptly report any material deterioration of the risks;Assist the RM / GRM in the preparation of budgets of the portfolios and supports them in achieving targets.
Scope and Purpose
Complementing the Branch commercial team, with a particular view to supporting the ongoing and expected growth of the European Hub customer portfolio.
You will be able to understand the logics of the DivisionYou will learn how the service operatesYou will develop familiarity with platforms and tasks of this role

Values
Collaboration is in Intesa Sanpaolo’s DNA. This is why our mission is to share the ideals and intentions that guide us in our work.
We evaluate our success based on how much we can invest to create an economic system in which everyone is able to express their potential.
Requirements
We are looking for someone with:
English FluentBachelor Degree Business, Economics or EngineerWorking knowledge in Corporate BankingUnderstanding of credit risk analysisGood communication skills, commercial attitudeTeam-player6 month / 1 year of relevant experience in Internship, ideally with international banks operating in the European region (a plus) IMICIBWO IMICIBSTUD

Selection
The selection process is divided in two phases: you will carry out a digital video interview and, if successful, we will invite you to an interview with colleagues from the concerned structure. In any case, you will receive feedback regarding your application.
Everyone is an asset for our Group and that person could be you! Check out our job opportunities, apply and join our team!

Data Analyst – Chapter Data
Your data management skills have an impact on our 9.5 million customers.
You and your job
As a Data Analyst you are the primary contact with our stakeholders, which are mostly consumers of the data in your data warehouse. You guide consumers in the usage of the data, validate new requirements of the business stakeholders and guide the (IT-) implementation of new initiatives. The Data Analyst represents customer and end-user concerns by gathering input from stakeholders to understand the problem to be solved. You may also help to identify potential areas of automation and support or advise the business in re-engineering the underlying business process.
Practical examples
You will take responsibility for data elements for their end-to-end usage across the enterprise
You do not involve just a single role but include a network of people with accountabilities for ensuring that all aspects of an effective data environment are being accomplished
You will tackle various data related issues and you will work on global and cross functional change projects to improve our processes and systems
Facts & figures
36 per week as standard (other options can be discussed)
43,822 Rabobank colleagues around the world
Top 3 responsibilities
You monitor and validate the data provided by your data warehouse. You also focus on ensuring BCBS239 compliancy
You define data requirements and give input to project scope/objectives through research, fact finding and elicitation with a solid understanding of business, systems, and requirements. You will participate in testing of changes against requirements and you develop knowledge of business analysis and business requirements
You represent the department and your team and act as a liaison between regulator and/or business needs, and the actual data. So you work with business users to ensure they can understand the data model and can use it to meet their needs
Together we achieve more than alone
Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do. Our team brings talented people together from various nationalities and backgrounds. As our colleague you will tackle various data related issues and play a role in global and cross domain efforts to improve our processes and systems.
We believe in the power of difference. Bringing together people's differences is what makes us an even better bank. So we are very curious about what you can bring to our team within Chapter Data.
Joris, Data Analyst: “Working as a Data Analyst for our teams in on our new data warehousing means working with data in an international environment during a large strategic transition. This involves the implementation of regulatory requirements, adherence to compliance and data management standards. Next to that accurately and timely processing of the data is key for meeting the reporting deadlines of our stakeholders.”
Our chapter brings a diverse, talented group of people to manage and develop the financial data platform of Rabobank. Working together is the way we work; as 1 data-minded team at Rabobank.
Talking of Rabobank: We are a Dutch bank that operates in 38 countries for over 9,5000,000 customers. Together with these customers, our members and partners we stand side by side to create a world in which everyone has access to enough healthy food. In the Netherlands we work to create a country in which people are happy with how they live, work and do business.
You and your talent
You have at least a Master degree in Economics, Finance, Business Administration or a related (quantitative) field
You have 5+ years of relevant banking experience within the financial industries sector
You have strong analytical and conceptual skills (databases, data warehouses and SQL)
You have knowledge of databases, data warehouses and SQL
You have strong communication skills in English, both spoken and written
This is what we offer you
a gross salary € 3,959.74 and € 6,741.24 (scale 9 or 10)
thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance
an extra budget of 11% of your gross salary to be used at your discretion. Buy extra holiday hours, add more to your pension savings or ask for part of the extra budget to be paid out
a pension scheme to which you contribute 5.5%
This is a selection of the terms of employment for a Data Analyst based on a 36-hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment.
You and the job application process
We look forward to your response to the vacancy of Data Analyst at Rabobank.
Any questions about the job content? Contact: Ryan Bartlett, Chapter Lead via Ryan.Bartlett@rabobank.com. Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Contact: Maaike Koster, Sr. Recruiter via Maaike.Koster@rabobank.nl
You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/nl/veelgestelde-vragen.
A security check is part of the process.
We respect your privacy.

Does Energy Transition energize you?! And would you like to really make it concrete and realize tangible impact? Then you might be looking for us! (And we for you!)
You and your job
Our vision is to be ‘The Bank of the Energy Transition in the eyes of the market’. The Energy Transition program is entering a new phase where, apart from innovation, the business is mobilised across all business lines. The business has identified more than 30 initiatives to take forward, in a program that will grow towards Euro 50 bn of investments by our clients to become more sustainable and achieve the Paris goals in 2030.
Now that the launch phase has been completed and a successful start has been made, we are looking for a Project Manager that can help the Lead Energy Transition Business Coach in driving and monitoring the progress of the energy transition initiatives, financing and impact (in terms of emission reduction and avoidance). And to support him in preparing insightful presentations on the progress, to the Energy Transition Leadership Team and many other stakeholders.
What can you expect
You will work closely together with the Lead Energy Transition Business Coach translating the Energy Transition strategy into a clear set of business initiatives, goals and metrics that help our clients and our bank in realizing the energy transition ambitions.
You will put a structure in place to monitor the initiatives’ progress, present the results in readable dashboards and will build relationships with the many stakeholders involved (in the business and in the Energy Transition Program itself).
You will structure the available management information to report on the growth of the energy transition financing and you will find ways to measure and report on their impact (emission reduction and avoidance)
You will support the development of new business steering metrics and mechanisms, that help prioritise initiatives from a risk, return and impact perspective.
You will develop insightful presentations showing the ambition, results and challenges of the Energy Transition program, to the Energy Transition Leadership Team and other stakeholders.
You will develop outside-in views and analyses to put the Rabobank progress on the Energy Transition in a market and/or competitive context, and challenge where necessary.
Business Updates Business Clients: Next to Energy Transition topics you can also be asked to support on an irregular basis to support the Head of Strategy and Innovation Business Clients on other hot topics within the business clients domain.
Facts & Figures
36 hours per week
>30 initiatives contributing >30bn of ET / sustainable investments from our clients
9.5 million customers around the world
Responsibilities
You will be responsible for managing a large group of stakeholders who are linked to the Energy Transition initiatives and to put a reporting structure in place to monitor the progress on those initiatives.
All in all you will learn and contribute how to steer and drive the Energy Transition program in the right direction and how to monitor, challenge and present the results in an inspiring and stimulating way, to a broad group of stakeholders throughout the bank. From that you will create a strong personal development base from which to develop further into follow-roles roles within e.g. the Energy Transition Innovation teams, Group Sustainability, other key projects environments or within the broader CFO domain.
Together we achieve more than alone
We believe in the power of diversity. Bringing together people's differences is what makes us an even better bank. So we are very curious about what you can bring to our team at the Energy Transition Program.
The approximate 30 people in the Energy Transition Program Team are working closely together with the business (Private Clients, Business Clients, Wholesale & Rural and DLL) to develop new customer journeys and innovative propositions to help our clients and the bank transition on our Road to Paris / pathway to Net Zero.
Working together is the way we work; as 1 passionate team at Rabobank.
You and your talent
You have a Master’s degree and affinity with strategy, business development, project management and/or control
A minimum of 2 years relevant working experience
Knowledge of Rabobank (contextual, cultural, structure)
Experience in working in a complex environment
You have affinity with creating insightful dashboards for oversight and project management and developing presentations for storytelling and communicating
You have refreshing ideas, an inquisitive mindset and are eager to learn more about steering and driving the energy transition
You are able to plan ahead and manage a range of different activities and stakeholders while keeping a good overview;
You are strong in collaborating / networking, but can also work and perform well independently, when driving your own projects
Fluent in English and Dutch
This is what we offer you
up to € 4.889,68 gross per month (scale 8)
Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance
an extra budget of 10% of your gross monthly salary to be used at your discretion. Buy extra holiday hours, add more to your pension savings or ask for part of the extra budget to be paid out.
a personal development budget of € 1,400-
a combination of working from home and at the office
This is selection of the terms of employment for a Project Manager Energy Transition
based on a 36-hour working week. This vacancy is for 36 hours per week. You can find all our terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment

Reply to the vacancy for Project Manager Energy Transition at Rabobank before 7th of April.
