ING Wholesale Banking (“WB”) is looking to hire a Sustainable Capital Markets intern with a strong ambition to work in the Capital Structuring, Liability Management & Sustainable Capital Markets team based in Amsterdam.
The Sustainable Capital Markets Team acts as an advisory boutique and is specifically geared towards offering tailor-made sustainable structuring solutions. The team is responsible for the structuring of capital markets funding instruments with green, social, sustainable or sustainability-linked labels, integrated sustainability advisory for clients including sustainability rating advisory, ESG reporting advisory, and expanding socially responsible investor (SRI) knowledge and distribution capabilities. Your internship will be in the Sustainable Capital markets team.
We are based in Amsterdam and London, but our team has a truly global reach operating as an overlay for ING’s Global Capital Markets franchise. Primary focus would be on EMEA clients, however also the clients of Americas, Asian and Middle Eastern teams are supported.
Job description:
Taking the lead in pitch preparation
Supporting DCM deal execution by means of support in preparing investor presentations and green shading of order books
Supporting the execution of structuring mandates for green, social and sustainable bonds
Help to identify market opportunities and monitor market developments and new ESG regulations by applying knowledge from various market sources (BloombergNEF, Environmental Finance, ICMA, macro-economic research, client specific news, etc.)
Liaise with other key ING stakeholders (e.g. other Sustainable departments, international and local DCM origination teams, DCM Syndicate & Financial Markets Sales, Research) to identify opportunities, enhance internal cooperation and to maximize client cross-sell

Who we are looking for:
To be considered for this internship we require the following knowledge and experience:
Demonstrable affinity with Sustainable Finance and Financial Markets
Well-rounded academic background with coursework in finance, economics, law, political science, international relations, sustainability & business studies preferred
Minimum of Bachelor degree required, Master level preferred from an internationally acclaimed university
Basic knowledge of Environmental, Social and Governance related topics
Basic knowledge of international bond markets and fixed income instruments is a plus
Basic knowledge of reading balance sheet, P&L and cash flow statements is a plus
Advanced Power Point and Excel skills
Fluent in English
Excellent (English) writing and verbal communication skills
Ability to work well under pressure and tight deadlines
What do we offer:
Unique opportunity to learn about Sustainable Capital Markets in practice
Advanced training on the job: Structuring process of capital markets funding instruments with green, social, sustainable or sustainability-linked labels, integrated sustainability advisory for our clients, deep knowledge of ESG regulations and ESG-rating methodologies
Live green, social and sustainable deal-execution experience with an active role in deals with high market visibility and international press coverage
Exposure to complex advisory projects requiring cooperation with other departments
Opportunity to create a network within ING as well as in the wider banking sector
Competitive allowance and reimbursement of public transport costs
You will be joining a small, highly skilled team who will be training and guiding you and as such, you will be seen as a full member of the team.
Prerequisites:
Applicants will need to be EU nationals or non-EU students enrolled in an EU university
Applicants need to be registered as a student with an educational institution for the full duration of the internship
Applicants need to be available full-time for the full duration of the internship

Euronext:
Euronext is the leading pan-European exchange in the Eurozone with a unique federal model across the Belgium, Dutch, French, Irish, Norwegian, Portuguese markets. Euronext also operates a UK-based regulated securities market.
Euronext brings together buyers and sellers in venues that are transparent, efficient and reliable, addressing the needs of all market participants: SMEs and blue chips, retail and institutional investors, buy-side and sell-side, brokers and market makers, long-only and high frequency traders.
Euronext provides a large range of products and services, services, platforms, technologies, and the deepest pool of liquidity in Europe around one core mandate: power pan-European capital markets to finance the real economy, as demonstrated by its leading position in the following segments:
The largest continental listing venue, with more than 1,500 issuers and a market cap of c.€4.3 in September 2019,
An unmatched blue chip franchise consisting of 24 out of 50 companies of the Morningstar® Eurozone 50 Index℠,
The #1 cash market in continental Europe, with an average daily volume of €7.9 billion in Q3 2019,
The largest centre for debt and funds listings in the world, with more than 40,000 listed bonds and 5,100 funds, and major player in ETFs with close to 1,200 listings,
A diversified financial derivative franchise including stock options and futures, dividend contracts and equity index derivatives,
The leading commodities business in continental Europe for salmon, milling wheat, rapeseed and corn futures,
The calculation and management of more than 400 indices, ranging from national flagship indices (AEX®, BEL 20®, CAC 40®, ISEQ®, PSI 20®, OSEBX®) to thematic, strategic and sectorial indices.
Euronext has recently expanded its footprint with a new corporate services suite and foreign exchange trading.
Euronext Corporate Services:
Euronext Corporate Services is a department of the Euronext group launched in 2016. As part of its strategic plan, Euronext has engaged into the development of a complete service offering to listed companies. Euronext Corporate Services offers innovative solutions and tailor-made advisory services to support the listed companies’ journey on the capital markets.
This unique and comprehensive value proposition is articulated around four main pillars:
Governance : Our board portal solution “iBabs” help organizations to secure, organize and run board meetings more efficiently (save time preparing agendas and board packs, collaborate easily with annotations, voting, meeting summaries).
Communication : We are the market leader in webinars and webcasts services for financial results, internal communication, marketing and external communication with our solution Company Webcast. We help our clients to increase their visibility, engagement and international coverage. We also provide flexible and customized market data components for Investor Relations websites of listed companies.
Compliance : Our InsiderLog solution offers a solution to automate the management of inside information and insider lists for both issuers and their professional advisors. Our tool aims to save time and ensure compliance with the European Market Abuse Regulation (MAR).
Investor Relations : Our Advisory team provides high-touch advisory, market intelligence and decision making analytics for listed companies willing to be more active on capital markets. Our IR.Manager tool provides a complete and intuitive IR management and targeting platform for corporate IR teams to professionalize the workflow and engagement.
Euronext Corporate Services already serves more than 2,500 clients including over 600 listed companies, private companies, advisors and public organisations. Our clients are located across all Euronext markets (Belgium, France, Netherlands, Portugal, Ireland) but also beyond (e.g. UK, Nordics, Italy, Spain, Germany).
The Euronext Corporate Services team is composed of over 100 enthusiastic professionals that combine a strong local footprint across Europe with a deep understanding of global capital markets. They help organisations, both listed and non-listed, private and public, make the most effective use of capital markets and run more efficiently. Read more at https://corporateservices.euronext.com/
IBabs:
Europe’s fastest growing board portal for 2,000+ organisations, iBabs empowers customers to quickly organise effective meetings and make good decisions confidently.
Our software application is the best on the market to distribute documents for Board and Committee meetings in a secure manner. We understand the work that goes into meetings – and how to streamline everything so it all flows smoothly on any device – confidentially, securely and automatically.
iBabs is present in Amsterdam, Brussels, London and Paris with every day over 200,000 users securely accessing their meeting documents and attending meetings - anytime, anywhere and on any device.
With our HQ in the Netherlands we have 20 years’ experience of delivering meeting solutions. We have a wide variety of customers from PLCs, private companies, Banks, Insurers and Investment funds to charities, housing associations, NHS, State bodies, Councils and Government Ministries.
With parent company Euronext we are currently expanding into Norway, Sweden, Finland, Denmark, Portugal, Spain, Germany and Italy.
Key accountabilities:
As a successful software (SaaS) company, iBabs has expanded significantly over the past few years in its domestic market (market leader player in the Netherlands) and internationally. It is now present with actives operations in the Netherlands, the UK, France, Germany, Spain, Italy and Nordic countries.
The company is now looking to professionalizing it’s Product Department and is thus actively seeking for a Product Designer. The successful candidate will have the below key responsibilities:
The Product Designer is responsible for conducting qualitative and quantitative research and collect data in order to understand and clarify user journeys, jobs to be done, pains and needs
Design prototypes (low/High fidelity), conduct ideations workshops, organize user tests, conduct user interviews and focus groups
Analyze all inputs and synthesize it with clear and communicable insights
Propose solutions through wireframes, prototypes and mockups
Conduct user tests to ensure usability and a best-in-class experience
Contribute and update the Design System
Work closely with users, the product team and the technical team to gain an in-depth understanding of product requirements
We expect the Product Designer that joins the team to bring focus to the work, structure to the team and clarity to the stakeholders. We have an intercultural environment where people that are eager to learn and to get things done can thrive and grow.

Desired skills and profile:
Experience with digital products and throughout the entire design process.
Care about solving the right problems for our users whilst ensuring it contributes to our strategy and product direction
Energetic, result-driven, functual, flexible, proactive and service-focused.
Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills, but always thinking about the user first.
Perfect command of Figma
Proficiency in Maze is a plus
Strong ability to innovate, show initiative, be curious and autonomous
The capacity to work in a multi-disciplinary team and be comfortable with creating as well as the technical side of things.
Strong prioritization skills and an execution-focused attitude.
Knows how to find the right balance between perfection and shipping quickly
Team player who is motivated, pro-active, creative and inspires others
A Bachelor degree in business, computer science or any other related field
A minimum of 3 years relevant experience in product design
Previous work experience in B2B SaaS
A track record in designing professional interfaces (the portfolio will be asked)
Experience in performing various user research methods
Ability to solve user problems with a strong sense of design
Excellent communication and organisational skills
The capacity to work well in a team
Fluent in English, Dutch is a plus.
Euronext Values
Unity We respect and value the people we work with We are unified through a common purpose We embrace diversity and strive for inclusion
Integrity We value transparency, communicate honestly and share information openly We act with integrity in everything we do We don’t hide our mistakes, and we learn from them
Agility We act with a sense of urgency and decisiveness We are adaptable, responsive and embrace change We take smart risks
Energy We are positively driven to make a difference and challenge the status quo We focus on and encourage personal leadership We motivate each other with our ambition
Accountability We deliver maximum value to our customers and stakeholders We take ownership and are accountable for the outcome We reward and celebrate performance
We remain committed to providing a positive hiring and onboarding experience for our candidates during these unprecedented times. Where our offices can open safely, they will remain open; otherwise our employees are able to work efficiently from home. The well-being of our employees, their families, our external partners and visitors is our upmost priority and we are closely following Government guidance in all our locations to ensure all health and safety guidance are met.
We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, gender, age, citizenship, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or any other legally protected factor. We value the unique talents of all our people, who come from diverse backgrounds with different personal experiences and points of view and we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect.
Additional Information
This job description is only describing the main activities within a certain role and is not exhaustive. It does not prevent to add more tasks, projects.

Interested in a job in IT and contributing to a better world? Discover your best self with the Young Engineering Professional Program.
You and your future
During the Young Engineering Professional Program (also known as YEPP) at Rabobank you work on your career one day a week by following a technical track, or you work on your personal development. You develop talents you didn’t know you had and we are given the space to discover for yourself what you are good at and what you like. And then? Everything you learn in the training courses can immediately be put into practice, because the other 4 days you work in your starter position as a Junior DevOps Engineer. Under the guidance of experienced colleagues, you will become a specialist in your field in no time. In addition, in the program you will work together with the team on 2 business challenges on themes such as sustainable agriculture or the cooperative energy transition.
Imagine… that you are that Junior Software Engineer, who ensures that a customer can realize certain dreams. That no day is the same, you deal with challenges that benefit you and your colleagues and that we as a team continuously improve. That you create maximum customer value with the team and that customer satisfaction is a matter of course for you. Besides working passionately, we also have fun together. These are the main ingredients for the (further) development and management of applications. With your team you provide more convenience and payment security for our customers.
Create impact
You can make a difference by taking responsibility for the software from A to Z: from idea to going live and improving functionalities for our users. You build it, you run it! in our DevOps way of working. You inspire the team with the latest digital developments, show initiative and come up with improvement proposals.
Examples
The team recently started a new proposition: Push Account Notification. This means building an entirely new API.
Practical
Length: Young Engineering Professional Program: 18 months.
After which you will continue to work with us as Junior software engineer.
Hours per week: 40.
Your development
To become the specialist in your professional field, in the Young Engineering Professional Program 1 day a week you mainly attend training courses that that support your talent development. The courses are often given by experienced colleagues or trainers with a track record. You build your network, gain valuable experience and develop skills which will be of use to you later in your career.

Learning from each other
Development is our top priority. Because the best way to learn is by doing, through mistakes and successes. At Rabobank we offer you the right balance between freedom and supervision. To develop talents you never thought you possessed. To specialize in a professional field or explore the things you're good at and enjoy doing. During the Young Engineering Professional Program you can count on us for excellent supervision. You'll work with experienced colleagues and have lots of contact with young professionals.
Talking of Rabobank: We are a Dutch bank that operates in 38 countries for over 9,500,000 customers. Together with these customers, our members and partners we stand side by side to create a world in which everyone has access to enough healthy food. In the Netherlands we work to create a country in which people are happy with how they live, work and do business.
You and your talent
A bachelor or master degree, or an equivalent working / thinking level.
Affinity with software development, and already some experience with the programming language [JAVA].
Excellent proficiency in English.
Feedback makes you stronger.
Learns from mistakes.
Adaptive to changing situations.
Focus on the solution.
This is what we offer you
Most of all, we offer you an 18 month long rich learning experience, while you advance your career towards an expert in your field.
A gross monthly salary in function scale 7.
A combination of working from home and at the office.
A personal development budget of € 1,400-.
This is a selection of the terms of employment for a Junior Software Engineer based on a 40-hour working week.

You and the job application process
We believe in the power of difference. Bringing together people's differences is what makes us an even better bank. What can you bring to Rabobank? We can't wait to hear from you.
So get in touch straightaway:
A technical assessment and/or a personality assessment is part of the selection process.
Interviews will be held via MS Teams or at our office in Utrecht.
A security check is part of the process.
We respect your privacy.

Today, companies are constantly urged to drastically reduce their carbon footprint. By trading in a wide variety of sustainable energy products and certificates, STX enables businesses to achieve this goal; "we make environmental markets work". In doing so, we contribute to a more transparent environmental commodities market and, therefore, a greener world. We're looking for a Strategy and Business Development Associate to join our Renewable Gas Team and the extremely dynamic market we operate in, and to embark on a journey with us towards a better tomorrow.

ABOUT THE FRONT OFFICE

Turning opportunities into solutions – that's the specialty of STX's Front Office. Our team works across various domains, including electricity, renewable gas, carbon offsets, biofuels, and energy efficiency. We engage with clients in different markets and countries daily, and it's our job to understand their needs and translate them into effective, efficient solutions. To maintain STX's position as the market leader in the fast-changing environmental commodities field, we are continuously capitalizing on new opportunities and optimizing our offering.

ABOUT THE TEAM

"The Renewable Gas Desk has a clear mission: to help customers that are experiencing difficulties when it comes to achieving their environmental targets. We help them transition from fossil fuels to renewable alternatives. Our team originates new products or solutions on behalf of our clients and that requires an innovative mindset, especially in this new market, which is largely uncharted territory. It also calls for a high level of ambition, a hunger for knowledge and an intrinsic will to help customers reduce their carbon footprint and decrease operational risk." – Sead Keric, Head of Renewable Gas Desk

ROLE OF A BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT ASSOCIATE

At STX it is our ambition to become the leading global environmental commodity trader and we are well on our way. We perceive building out our presence across the global Renewable Gas value chains of paramount strategic importance in achieving this ambition. In this role, you will be working closely with our Strategy and Business Development Director and work directly with the different Renewable Gas focused teams to shape and deliver our strategic agenda. Together with the managing partner we will define the most pressing strategic priorities to work on across our teams, ranging from shaping business strategy for specific product groups ("squares"), to framing-up business cases for strategic investments/partnerships, to structuring and defining our approach for new market entries and/or new product desks; all in close collaboration with our trading teams. This is a truly unique opportunity to play a pivotal, hands-on, role in shaping our global presence in the Renewable Gas space.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Shaping strategic/business plans together with different product trading desks within the Renewable Gas space
Driving and supporting business development opportunities (setting up new business lines across and expansion into new geographies), including cross-desk/product opportunities
Working with the business on the implementation of the strategy (e.g., structuring and building business cases for strategic investments/partnerships, coordinating interlinkages with mid-office, hiring, new processes)
Driving, together with the team, the continuous re-defining, supporting, tracking and (constructively) challenging of the longer-term strategy for the Renewable Gas desks
Working with senior leadership (managing partner & strategy and business development director) on variety of other key strategic topics such as hiring/people strategy, board/executive team updates, etc.

KEY REQUIREMENTS
5+ years of work experience
Experience at a management consulting firm or business development/(corporate) strategy department within a relevant industry (e.g., commodity trading)
Strong strategic and commercial mindset to support shaping longer term vision and drive shorter term opportunities (e.g., business case development, market assessments/entry strategies)
Exposure to energy (trading) industry and/or sustainability topics is ideal
Able to manage projects independently and manage lead stakeholders
Self-propelling and entrepreneurial
Living or open to relocate to Amsterdam or Gothenburg

COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS

Competitive remuneration package
Strong focus on coaching and personal & professional development
Operating within fast-paced and entrepreneurial company
Professional and international working environment

GET IN TOUCH

Are you ready to embark on a journey with us? Please submit your application for this job by clicking on the "apply" button. For further questions, please contact the Recruitment department at recruitment@stxgroup.com.

STX Group offers equal employment opportunity. Acquisition based on this vacancy is not appreciated.

#LI-Hybrid #LI-AV1

On our path to becoming the world’s favorite way to shop, we’re assembling an unparalleled global talent network, accelerating individual careers, and disrupting entire industries. We are on a mission to liberate humanity from all the meaningless time spent managing their purchases and finances, so they can do more of what they love. We’re in search of global talent eager to embrace our atmosphere and defy their own expectations.
Klarna's customer service department handles hundreds of thousands of contacts across multiple markets every single day. Within Process Design & Optimization, you will lead holistic and systemic change in the CS processes, driving optimization, automation, and outsourcing opportunities. Acting as a partner to our markets, you will lead proper transformation and be able to ‘move the needle’ in our KPIs. Through data analysis, and stakeholder engagement, you will surface and solve complex issues, owning the planning, implementation, coordination, and communication of the different programs that span across different functions (product, legal, training, compliance, operations, and others).
What you'll do
Analyze different data parameters and draw concrete conclusions
Assessing and analyzing risks and controls for processes based on alignment with process owners/performers.
Critical analysis of process design to identify opportunities for improvement as well as control weaknesses.
Oversight of process modeling and enforcement of modeling standards and best practices, including confirming and agreeing on process flowcharts and narratives with process/product owners.
Leveraging process modeling to drive enhanced process management, including standardization, simplification, outsourcing, and process automation.
Training and coaching of stakeholders to ensure successful uptake of best practices.
Change/project management to steer rapid delivery of transformation objectives.
Identify and drive improvement initiatives around Product, Process, and Reporting, across all the markets.
Collaborating with Risk Control, Legal, and Compliance to ensure that processes are documented and controlled in accordance with the necessary requirements and that 1st and 2nd line controls are aligned.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration/similar field or equivalent experience
Experience in Consulting, Customer Service Operations, Operations Management, or E-commerce
Strong project/program management skills. Experience leading large cross-functional and data-driven projects
Service and customer obsession mindset
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and evolving environment
Data-driven mindset, strong analytical and problem-solving ability
Strong stakeholder management skills and ability to perform under pressure
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
What we offer:
Diversity & Community
With our diversity of skills, perspectives and backgrounds, we can create, innovate, and disrupt like no other. Diversity is part of who we are, and essential to our success.
Ownership & Impact
Here, every voice matters. We’re organized into hundreds of small teams, each run like a start-up, focused on their own problem-space.

Trust & Collaboration
Successes and failures are won together at Klarna in a melting pot of teams. Win, lose, and learn, we’re on this path together.
If you love what you do, you should love where you do it. We appreciate that everyone’s different and has their own preferences of where and how to work. We genuinely believe in the power of regular face-to-face interactions in building close connections with our teams, but we also strongly believe people can work effectively remotely. This means that combining both is the key to success.
At Klarna, You can choose between working from the office, remotely within your employment country, or even outside of it for up to 20 working days per year. Flex it up! ﻿
Challenges & Rewards
We take a very Swedish approach to benefits. Support for parents, health and wellness perks—we’ve got you covered.

About Klarna
Since 2005 Klarna has been on a mission to revolutionize the retail banking industry. With over 150 million global active users and 2 million transactions per day, Klarna is meeting the changing demands of consumers by saving them time and money while helping them be informed and in control. Over 450,000 global retail partners, including H&M, Saks, Sephora, Macys, IKEA, Expedia Group, and Nike have integrated Klarna's innovative technology to deliver a seamless shopping experience online and in-store. Klarna has over 6,000 employees and is active in 45 markets. For more information, visit Klarna.com
It is our commitment that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender, identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Making a difference with reliable and user-friendly digital workplace services
The ING tribe Workplace Services is responsible for the digital workplace of all 55.000+ global ING employees. We ensure that our colleagues can work simply and safely with any device, wherever they are. We deliver services that are vital to ING’s business operations, so when working for our team, you can make a tremendous impact! Are you up for it?
We provide hardware (such as laptops & mobile solutions and video conferencing tools) and a large variety of business productivity software, including collaboration services such as Teams, SharePoint and Outlook. We also provide the infrastructure and 3rd line support for these services. WPS has standardised on SaaS (cloud) services and ING is still one of the first financial institutions that have fully committed to a truly Modern Workplace based on Microsoft 365.
ING: the next step in your career
The WPS tribe has a well-established track record of attracting and growing top talents from all over the world. WPS for many is the first step into the ING world, the beginning of a great career in ‘The IT-company with a banking license’.
To enable our ongoing success, we are constantly looking for experienced IT engineers with a passion for workplace services. Apply if you are interested and we will jointly find the best fit for you in our organisation!
What will you do?
You are maintaining and improving our services as part of a cross-border squad of peers and customer journey experts. User satisfaction is key to us!
SaaS vendors constantly release new features; you will help to keep up and preferably stay ahead with our own feature requests to them.
You and your colleagues will be developing the services for the future, automating and simplifying it, as well as making them more robust and secure.
We are a valued partner for many of the big suppliers, including Microsoft. You are in frequent contact with their key staff / product groups.
Were a bank, so we are highly regulated - we must be if we want to safeguard our clients’ data. This requires thorough administration and strong processes; can you automate these and make them less of a burden.
No day will be the same, we work agile. We stimulate proactivity - you have the freedom to choose your own course of action for projects and other tasks whenever possible.
We provide a 24/7 global service. You will also share the responsibilities of the team in solving 3rd line incidents on a rotation-based scheme, doing administration and participate in standby services.
Your profile
We are looking for the seasoned IT experts with at least 5 years of experience in comparable roles and ideally the following additional qualifications:
Education and experience
You have a master’s degree in Computer Science, Business Administration, IT Audit or a related field or equivalent work experience.
You have IT experience with Microsoft 365 technology in an enterprise-level multinational organisation, including relevant Microsoft 365 certifications to show for it.
With respect to automation: PowerShell has no secrets for you, and you have experience with automated Deployment in Azure DevOps pipelines for both scripts and configuration as code.
You understand the principles of outsourcing on operational, tactical and strategic levels with E2E accountability of the WPS Services delivered across multiple external and internal parties.
You have worked in highly regulated environments like financial institutions before.
Personal skills
You are a frequent visitor of conferences and meet-ups, you constantly try to improve yourself. Furthermore, you like to challenge others to improve as well, and you train and/or coach them.
You know how to manage stakeholders on all organisation levels, you can easily work together with them to achieve your goals. You can develop strong and collaborative partnerships with organisational leaders.
You know how to visualise, articulate, and solve complex problems.
In your previous roles, you were the ‘go-to-person’ for the team when encountering challenges. You are a genuine team player.
You have excellent communication skills, capable of conveying complex technical topics to various audiences.
Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of colour are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At ING we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.
Your benefits
We offer you a career with a 36 or 40-hour contract and a unique proposal that fits in with modern day times. At ING, we have a hybrid mode model where people have the flexibility to work from the office and from home to have a better work-life balance.
What we offer:
A salary tailored to your qualities and experience, including a reimbursement for travel expenses.
Flexible working hours and the possibility to work from home for at least 50%.
24-27 vacation days depending on your contract.
Pension scheme, 13th month salary, 8% holiday payment and an Individual Savings Contribution (BIS) of 3.5% of your gross annual salary.
A progressive way of working according to the Agile method, so that new ideas come to life.
Excellent courses and educational programs to help you fulfill your ambitions, as we understand the value of individual development for both you and us!
You’ll be part of a diverse and international workforce; based in Netherlands and Poland but consisting of 100% globally oriented experts.
An informal work environment, where we highly value inclusivity and stimulate you to be you.
Find out more about our additional employment conditions online.
So, are you looking for an IT job opportunity in an interesting, fast-moving and international environment? We are open for your application!

job_titles: Project manager Compliance Risk & Control Framework
job_description:
As a Project Manager Compliance Risk and Control Framework, you can make a difference by managing the process of continuously improving the Global Compliance Risks & Controls set and contributing to the global execution of the Systematic Integrity Risk Assessment (SIRA) and for the Rabobank Group.
You and your job
On a day-to-day basis, you will have a variety of tasks, including project management, stakeholder management with first and second line colleagues to improve the global Risk and Control set. Also participating in working groups, data analysis and reporting on conclusions. You, as project manager within the Risk & Data team, are the first point of contact of the global compliance network and serve this network accordingly.
Facts & Figures
32-36 hours per week
9 colleagues within the Risk & Data team
43,822 Rabobank colleagues around the world
Top 3 responsibilities
you will give lead to the transformation to an agile way of working within the team, helping the team to give clear insight in the activities and coaching the team to grow in the agile way of working;
you will be the bridge between conceptualizing and actioning ideas on continuous improvement within the team;
you will build positive relationships with colleagues within the Compliance departments, by serving as their primary point of contact.
As a Project manager Compliance Risk and Control Framework you will be part of the Risk & Data team, which is one of the 4 teams of the Monitoring, Validation, Risk and Data department within the Compliance department of Rabobank Group. One of the most dynamic department of the bank. Compliance has a key role in the promotion and safeguarding of the integrity as well as the reputation of Rabobank Group. Compliance promotes and monitors that the integrity and compliance rules are closely adhered to through its teams dedicated to business line compliance for the various markets (e.g. Retail Netherlands, Rural & Retail, Wholesale, Member Banks), as well as the expertise centre on themes such as market abuse, conflicts of interests and financial economic crime.
Together we achieve more than alone
We believe in the power of difference. Bringing together people's differences is what makes us an even better bank. So we are very curious about what you can bring to our team at Risk &Data.
‘Dynamic risk Management within Compliance offers you the opportunity to see all aspects of Compliance and you get the chance to work with a wide variety of teams and people. there is a lot of room for development, innovation and initiative’.
Ashwin Hollart, Senior Compliance Risk Officer
The 20-25 people in MVRD drive data driven compliance and are responsible for the setup of an agile data driven compliance organization including the risk and data expertise in the compliance department. Working together is the way we work; as 1 result driven and effective team at Rabobank. Talking of Rabobank: We are a Dutch bank that operates in 38 countries for over 9,5000,000 customers. Together with these customers, our members and partners we stand side by side to create a world in which everyone has access to enough healthy food. In the Netherlands we work to create a country in which people are happy with how they live, work and do business.
You and your talent
Bachelor or Master in Audit, Finance, Economics, Law or Business Administration.
At least 5-10 years of relevant experience in a Financial Institution (or Financial Authority or as consultant.
Managing projects in an agile way is your given nature;
Experience with operational risk management or compliance is a nice to have but not a must;
Fluent in English and excellent stakeholder management skills are very important
This is what we offer you
up to € 6.741,- gross per month (scale 10)
Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance
an extra budget of 11% of your gross salary to be used at your discretion. Buy extra holiday hours, add more to your pension savings or ask for part of the extra budget to be paid out.
a combination of working from home and at the office #LI-HYBRID
This is a selection of the terms of employment for a Project Manager Compliance Risk & Control Framework based on a 36-hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment.

You and the job application process
Reply to the vacancy for Compliance Risk Officer at Rabobank before April 11th 2023.
Any questions about the job content? Contact: Minke Visser, Team Lead Risk & Data via minke.visser01@rabobank.nl or 06- 255 471 20.
Responses will be handled in accordance with vacancy management.
Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Katja Volmerink, Senior Recruiter Compliance, via katja.volmerink@Rabobank.nl.
We will hold the interviews through a video call.
You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/en/faq.
A security check is part of the process.
We respect your privacy.

BI Analyst
Do you want to use your financial insights to contribute to the management of a Dutch bank and deliver innovative insights to our customers? Then we are looking for you!
You and your role
As BI Analyst, you are responsible for continuously improving insight into the financial performance of our 'Private & Business clients' sub-area. You will bring your expertise to deliver reliable information and insights to our 800,000 business clients. You will work in an agile squad with 10 other professionals, 6 of whom are women.
Practical examples
You develop a ChatBot that provides stakeholders with the latest management information;
You provide support to the 'businesses' department by giving them insight into their performance via dashboards;
You work on strategically linking data sources.
Facts & figures
This is a full-time position of 36 hours per week;
You will work in an agile squad with 10 other professionals, 6 of whom are women;
Rabobank has 43,822 colleagues worldwide;
An assessment is part of the application process.
Top 3 responsibilities
Finding, analysing, structuring, modelling and transforming data into information;
Handling (internal) customer queries and stakeholder communications;
Supporting and maintaining applications that provide automated management information to the bank.
At Rabobank, we believe in the power of differences. We are therefore curious to know what you will add to our BI & Analytics team. Together with our enthusiastic colleagues, we make the difference and make fact-based management possible.
Together we achieve more than alone
We believe in the power of differences. It is precisely by combining people's differences that we become an even better bank. We are therefore curious to hear what you add to our BI & Analytics team.
'Our squad is the centre for management information for the NL domain. Together with our enthusiastic colleagues, we make the difference and make fact-based management possible.' - Ellen van Laere, Product Owner.
'It's fun to see the squads grow, take responsibilities and how each individual contributes in their own way to the team dynamics and the end result' - Bas Wieman, Area Lead
The 100 people at Tribe BI & Analytics analyse and optimise the management reporting infrastructure. Working together is our way of working; as 1 result-oriented team within Rabobank. Talking about Rabobank: we are a Dutch bank, active in 38 countries for our more than 9,500,000 customers. With these customers, our members and partners, we work side by side towards a world in which everyone has enough and healthy food to eat. Closer to home, we work towards a country in which happy people live, work and do business.
You & your talent
HBO/WO degree in the field of Business Economics, Finance or IT;
You are fluent in Dutch and English, both verbally and in writing;
3-5 years' experience in the financial sector or data analysis;
Want to improve every day;
Focused on the solution;
Encourage cooperation.
This is what we offer you
Up to €5,600,- gross per month (scale 9).
Extra budget of 11% of your gross monthly salary that you can spend as you wish. Buy extra holidays, deposit extra money in your pension or have the budget partially paid out.
Thirteenth month and 8% holiday pay.
A combination of working from home and at a Rabobank location.
This is a selection of the employment conditions for a BI Analyst based on a 36-hour working week. You can find all employment conditions at rabobank.jobs/en/employment-conditions.
You and the job application process
For substantive questions about this position: Bas Wieman, Area Lead at Bas.Wieman@rabobank.com.
Responses will be processed in accordance with vacancy management.
Questions about working at Rabobank and the procedure? Rose Osté, Recruiter via rose.oste@rabobank.nl.
Interviews take place via video call.
Answers to frequently asked questions can be found at Frequently Asked Questions - Working at Rabobank.
A reliability assessment is part of the procedure.
We respect your privacy.

This is going to be your job
The Orchestration and Integration department (O&I) within Asset Management COO wants to have a positive impact on the purpose and vision of APG Asset Management. O&I is a contributor to the 2 strategic enabler pillars: Digitalization and People & Culture. O&I’s purpose is to deliver seamless, coherent & sustainable IT experience. On behalf of the Orchestration & Integration department at APG Asset Management (AM), we are looking for a DevOps Integration (Cloud) Data Engineer for the Data Integration team.
As a Cloud Data Integration Engineer you are one of the crucial players in the journey of creating a Data Platform that provides Data Access to Data Consumers after a one-time onboarding of Data Producers.
You are responsible for realizing some Data Platform Features, in line with the PO and Data Architect of the team. Furthermore it is a plus if you can take the existing small team along in its journey into the Azure Cloud and pro-actively share your knowledge and best practices on Data Integration in MS Azure.

The end state of this journey is to deliver a futureproof integration solutions that complies with and is in line with APG AM’s Digitization objectives and roadmap, moving us in the direction of AM’s Integration Centre of excellence.
You will be located in Amsterdam or Heerlen.
This is what you offer
You think in terms of opportunities and are service minded. Taking ownership and accepting responsibility comes naturally to you. You have a pragmatic attitude and are motivated to deliver quality.
a master’s degree, preferably in business administration, information science or a comparable qualification, or experience at a working level comparable to a masters level;
Proven knowledge and around two years of hands-on experience on Microsoft Azure Cloud.
It is a pre if you have worked connecting the Metadata of Collibra with the Data on Azure.
highly developed communication skills in English,
experience with Agile way of working,
preferably knowledge & experience of Asset Management
This is where you'll work
We offer you salary of € 4.750 - € 6.750 based on a 40 hours working week and attractive terms of employment with a focus on flexibility.
A guaranteed year-end bonus of 8.33%.
Ample attention to your vitality and personal development.
Hybrid working: at home and in one of our superb offices.
And of course a well organized pension.
For pension provider APG, pensions are about people, life and how we live together. Through careful asset management, pension administration, communication and advice, APG wants to help build a decent future in which we share our well-being and prosperity honestly and sustainably. For present and future generations. For today, tomorrow and beyond.
APG is committed to serving 4.7 million people in the Netherlands. That explains the importance we attach to reflecting Dutch society. To that end, APG strives for an inclusive work environment in which everyone can be themselves and their unique qualities are embraced. Choosing APG means choosing a job in which you contribute to a bright future. Don’t delay, apply today!
